definition: condition/physical appearance (of a museum piece, item of food produced by a chef, postage stamp etc)
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: With regard to improving the type, use the best male you can afford.
sentences.chinese: 爲了改良品相，你需要儘可能地用最好的公貓。

sentences.english: The coin of natural patina, font dignified atmosphere, is perfectly preserved.
sentences.chinese: 該錢幣包漿自然，字體端莊大氣，品相保存完美。

sentences.english: The goal of the subgrades is to further define the condition of a particular figure.
sentences.chinese: 給定分項評分的目的是爲了進一步明確某玩具的品相。

sentences.english: Speical stones for people enjoyment are very rich in Shandong province.
sentences.chinese: 山東觀賞石資源十分豐富，種類多，造型美，品相佳。

sentences.english: The market is saturated with good used books.
sentences.chinese: 市場上充斥着品相良好的二手書。

definition: relative purity of silver or gold/purity in carat weight/quality/fineness
binding and layout (of a book etc)
the rarer sth is, the greater its value (idiom)
